OpticalSystems module¶

OpticalSystems.py

This module contains classes for simulating and analyzing optical systems.

Note: More reasonable interface for accessing and calculating of the PSF and OTF is expected in the future. For this reason the detailed documentation on the computations is not provided yet.

class OpticalSystems.OpticalSystem(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for optical systems, providing common functionality. The base class implements all the functionality but cannot be implemented. Use dimensional children classes instead.

supported_interpolation_methods¶

List of supported interpolation methods.

Type:

list

psf¶

Point Spread Function.

Type:

np.ndarray

otf¶

Optical Transfer Function.

Type:

np.ndarray

interpolator¶

Interpolator for OTF.

Type:

scipy.interpolate.RegularGridInterpolator

_otf_frequencies¶

Frequencies for OTF.

Type:

np.ndarray

_psf_coordinates¶

Coordinates for PSF.

Type:

np.ndarray

_interpolation_method¶

Interpolation method.

Type:

str

static azimuthal_zernike(m, phi)[source]¶

Compute the azimuthal part for Zernike polynomial Z_n^m. - if m >= 0: cos(m * phi) - if m < 0: sin(|m| * phi)

phi is a 1D array of angles.

abstractmethod compute_psf_and_otf() → tuple[ndarray[tuple[int, int, int], float64], ndarray[tuple[int, int, int], float64]][source]¶

Compute the PSF and OTF.

abstractmethod compute_psf_and_otf_cordinates(psf_size: tuple[int], N: int)[source]¶

Compute the PSF and OTF coordinate axes.

Parameters:

  • psf_size (tuple) – Size of the PSF.

  • N (int) – Number of points.

static compute_pupil_plane_abberations(zernieke_polynomials, rho, phi)[source]¶

Construct a 2D pupil-plane aberration by summing Zernike modes using HCIPy’s zernike().

Parameters:

  • zernieke_polynomials (dict) – Dictionary with keys = (n, m) and values = amplitudes. Example: {(2, 2): 0.1, (3, 1): -0.05, (4, -2): 0.07, …}

  • rho (ndarray) – 1D array of radial coordinates (0 <= rho <= 1 typically).

  • phi (ndarray) – 1D array of azimuthal coordinates (in radians, e.g. -π to +π or 0 to 2π).

Returns:

aberration – The resulting 2D aberration (same shape as rho, phi).

Return type:

ndarray

dimensionality = None¶

property q_grid¶
static radial_zernike(n, m, r)[source]¶

Compute the radial part R_{n,|m|}(r) of the Zernike polynomial for each r in the 1D array r.

supported_interpolation_methods = ['linear', 'Fourier']¶

A list of currently supported interpolation methods. Other scipy interpolation methods are not directly supported due to high memory usage. Add them to the list if needed. Currently, meaningless, but changes are expected. Fourier is interpolation is used for SIM by default. Linear interpolation is available with the “interpolate_OTF” method if needed.
